As we prepare to start school Wednesday, August 12, it is important for parents to answer the following questions EVERY day for their child.

1. Have you had a fever in the last 24 hours?
2. Do you have a consistent cough?
3. Are you short of breath or have difficulty breathing while resting (not exercise induced)?
4. Do you have a sore throat?
5. Have they been in close contact with someone who is being tested or who has tested positive for COVID-19?

If you answer yes to any of these questions, Mrs. Lash, our corporation nurse strongly recommends you keep your child home and contact your doctor.

You know your child best. You know what normal is for your child. Mrs. Lash will be following state and local health department recommendations for allowing students to remain in school or to return if absent.

More information can be found on our school website under the nurses page.

We look forward to seeing all of the students Wednesday!

post_text: We have had an increased number of students and staff diagnosed with Influenza A in the past weeks. Along with these, other students are absent with flu-like symptoms. As a reminder, please keep your child home if fever is above 100.0. They should not return to school until they are fever free (less than 100.0) for 24 hours WITHOUT fever-reducing medication (Tylenol or Ibuprofen). Giving your student these medications and then sending to school only masks the symptoms and then students continue to pass it onto others. Thank you for understanding and keeping our students healthy.
